result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L. Lochner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs due during period of supervision.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment

No contact with Michael Kneepkens.
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Agent to be informed of all prescriptions before having them filled; only use one pharmacy; sign authoriozation for agent to talk with treating physician and/or pharmacy.

Defendant to submit to random testing.
Submit to DNA sample by 3/25/16.
Cooperate with Child Protective Services.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amanda L. Lochner in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Defendant Amanda L. Lochner in court with Attorney Jamie Mcclendon.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Mcclendon requests an adjournment to finalize the pretrial with the State. 
Plea and Sentencing, March 9, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Cooperate with Child Protection Agency

Defendant Amanda L. Lochner in court with attorney  Public Defender's Office.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.  Further proceedings scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Copy of the notice of hearing/complaint sent to public defenders office as the defendant has representation by their office in a cross referenced case.
